==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|しょ|じょ|yomi=o}}

===Etymology===
From {{etyl|zhx|ja|sort=しょじょ}} {{m|zh|sc=Hani|處女}}. <span class="IPA">/syodyo/ > /syozyo/</span>

Originally referred in Japanese to a woman in a house ([{{l|ja|家}}{{l|ja|に}}]{{l|ja|処|tr=い}}{{lang|ja|る}}{{l|ja|女}}), more specifically to an [[unmarried]] [[woman]].

===Pronunciation===
* [[音読み|On'yomi]]
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[ɕʲo̞d͡ʑʲo̞]}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|しょじょ|hhira=しょぢょ|kyu=處女}}

# a [[virgin]], a [[maiden]], an [[unmarried]] [[woman]]
# for the first time; [[maiden]] (voyage, publication etc)

====Synonyms====
* {{sense|virgin}} {{ja-r|生娘|きむすめ}}
